Definition at line 12 of file CMVCard.php.

Member Function Documentation

add ( $  property,
$  value,
$  attr = array() 
)

Add a value to an attribute.

You may give an array for $value to add multiple values to the property.

Note:
This function does not check if the value is already associated with a property and always adds the new value on. For value checking see addUnique().
Parameters:
$property The name of the property, this must be a string. This is not case sensitive, all property names will always be converted and treated as upper case.
$value A string value or an array of multiple values to add.
$attr Extra attributes.
Returns:
true.

Definition at line 113 of file CMVCard.php.

addUnique ( $  property,
$  value 
)

Add a value to a property only if it doesnt exist yet.

This function works in the same way as add() but only adds the value(s) if they do not exist on the property.

Parameters:
$property The name of the property, this must be a string. This is not case sensitive, all property names will always be converted and treated as upper case.
$value A string value or an array of multiple values to add.
Returns:
true.

Definition at line 141 of file CMVCard.php.

CMVCard ( $  version = "3.0"  ) 

Create a new vCard.

Parameters:
$version An optional version for the vCard. Unless you have a special reason to force your vCard into an older format it is recommnded you leave this option out.

Definition at line 35 of file CMVCard.php.

get ( $  property  ) 

Get a property.

Properties are always an array, even when there is only one value associated with it.

Parameters:
$property Property name.
Returns:
An array of values associated with a property.

Definition at line 74 of file CMVCard.php.

getDisplayName (  ) 

Get the display name for this card.

Returns:
The name if it can be found otherwise "No name" will be returned.

remove ( $  property  ) 

Remove all values associated with a property.

Parameters:
$property The name of the property, this must be a string. This is not case sensitive, all property names will always be converted and treated as upper case.
Returns:
true.

Definition at line 164 of file CMVCard.php.

set ( $  property,
$  value,
$  attr = array() 
)

Set a property.

This method works differently from add() as this replaces all of the values associated with a property with the new value given. You are allowed to supply a string (which will automatically be converted into a single element array) or an array.

Parameters:
$property The name of the property, this must be a string.
$value A string value or an array of values to set the property to.
$attr Extra attributes. Ignored.
Returns:
true.

Definition at line 90 of file CMVCard.php.

setVersion ( $  newVersion  ) 

Manually set the version of this vCard.

Parameters:
$newVersion The new vCard version.
Returns:
true.
